p: The annual rate of population growth and GDP growth for Bangladesh in 2013 was 1.22% and 6.01%, respectively, whereas annual growth rate of CO 2 emission was about 2.13% in 2013 ( Table 1) (World Bank 2016). More specifically, each 1% increase in population in 2013 was associated with a 1.75% increase in CO 2 emissions, whereas each 1% increase in annual GDP was associated with a 0.35% increase in CO 2 emissions (World Bank 2016).
